title: Generic definitions used in the Global Coffee Dataset

productionCosts.title: The production costs
productionCosts.description: The simple approach asks only about the main costs in the production system that typically account for the vast majority of total costs (and the total amount spent on each during the last production year).

percentage.title: The portion used for coffee production
percentage.description: Costs should be associated with the coffee production only (i.e., if labor is hired for multiple crops, only the portion used for coffee production should be included). One way to make sure that costs are correctly associated with the production of the coffee is to ask for the percent of inputs that were used for the coffee.

percentage.title: The percentage
percentage.description: The percentage, from 0 to 100 with decimals allowed

positiveNumber.title: The positive number
positiveNumber.description: A positive number starting at 0 with decimals allowed

greaterThanZero.title: The positive number, greater than 0
greaterThanZero.description: A positive number starting at greater than 0 with decimals allowed
